pros: One of the best facility in Whatcom County, WA. My coworkers were all amazing and very easy to work with. The facility is well- maintained and very clean.
Great pay and great team members

review_title: Job pays the bills, if you love customer service.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Lynden, WA
pros: clean facility. Most of your coworker are kind enough to help out (with in your unit).
cons: Staffing is very poor at all times. Weekends are poorly staff especially. Units are on there own, I feel like we don't really work as a facility.  Some of LN don't even care if other units are poorly staff and and another unit is over staff.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Lynden, WA
pros:
*Best paying nursing home for night shift ($15/hr)
*evening shift is the most difficult shift but pays ($13.25)
*decent sign on bonus
cons:
*Consistently short staffed
*Have to watch for errors on paystub
*Administration and Nurses seem to dislike there jobs therefore it's hard to feel welcomed
*Aids have a difficult time with team work
*Very Catty And hostile work environment 
*FT benefits suck

pros: The pay was very nice and the patients were wonderful.
cons: It was very hard to get time off when you needed it.  Nobody would talk about issues and they would not get taken care of.
